# usesFindBar

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether to use the find bar for this text view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var usesFindBar: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the find bar is used for this text view; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder] for information about the find bar.

A text view can use either a find panel or a find bar. If [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/usesFindBar] is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true],  [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/usesFindPanel] is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] and vice versa.

## Related Documentation

- **usesFindPanel**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver allows for a find panel.

## Using the Find Bar

- **isIncrementalSearchingEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether incremental searching is enabled.
